    Templates

    Templates

    Prompts, etc

    Prompts

    General

    Career Story

    Here’s my resume and a summary of my experience. Act as an interview coach and help me turn this into a clear, confident, 60-second answer for ‘Tell me about yourself.’

    Mock Interview

    Here’s the job I’m applying for. Act as the interviewer, ask me one realistic interview question at a time, give me feedback on my response, then ask the next question.

    Top Wins

    Here are 5 accomplishments I’m proud of. Pick the strongest 3, turn them into short, high-impact interview stories that focus on results, and keep each under 60 seconds.

    Questions for Them

    Here’s what I care about in a job. Suggest 3 non-generic questions I could ask the interviewer that show I’ve done my homework.

    Interview Nerves

    I get nervous before interviews. Give me a simple 3-step mental prep routine to stay calm, confident, and focused.

    Career Change

    Here’s why I left my last role. Help me explain it clearly and professionally, in a way that shows maturity and forward momentum.

    Why You

    Here’s my background and the job description. Write a short answer to ‘Why should we hire you?’ that connects my skills to what they need.

    Real Weakness

    Here’s a weakness of mine and what I’ve done to improve it. Help me make it an honest answer that shows self-awareness and growth.

    What They Want

    Here’s a job description. Identify the top 3 traits or priorities the company is probably looking for based on the language in the post.

    Weak Spots

    Here’s an area of my experience I feel insecure about. Reframe it positively showing how it could still add value in this role.

    Coachability

    Here’s an example of when I took feedback well. Turn this into a concise interview story that shows I’m coachable and open to growth.

    5-Year Plan

    Here’s my long-term vision. Help me write a forward-looking answer to ‘Where do you see yourself in 5 years?’ that aligns with the role.

    Challenge Example

    Here’s a hard situation I handled at work. Rewrite it using the STAR method and keep it concise enough to say in under 90 seconds.

    Clearer Answers

    Here’s an answer I plan to give that isn’t as polished as I’d like. Rewrite it to sound more confident, clear, and easy to say out loud.

    Mistake Check

    Here’s the job post and my background. What interview mistakes or red flags should I avoid based on this match?

    The Revenue Simulator

    Simulate 3 paths to $10K/months for a creator with [niche, audience size, offers]. Show the exact breakdown of content -> leads -> sales.

    The Viral Hook Lab

    Give me 30 hook variations for [topic] using advanced psychology triggers: Zeigarnik effect, identity signaling, curiosity loops, pattern breaks. Rank them by predicted viral potential.

    The Identity Builder

    Turn my story [insert your journey] into 3 archetypes that my audience can rally behind. Give me catchphrases, story arcs, and visual for each.

    Elevator Pitch

    Here’s who I am and what I do. Help me write a short, natural-sounding elevator pitch for this role that I can use in the first 30 seconds.

    Work Values

    Here are my top 3 work values. Help me come up with specific examples or phrases to show these in an interview naturally.

    Salary Expectations

    Here’s the role, my experience, and what I know about industry pay. Help me prepare a confident, fair answer to ‘What are your salary expectations?’

    Closing Statement

    Help me write a confident closing statement for the end of the interview that reinforces my fit, helps me stand out, and leaves a strong impression.

    Thank You Note

    Here’s how the interview went. Write a short thank-you note that feels personal, reinforces my fit for the role, and keeps the door open for next steps.

    Image editing

    Template

    Any Markdown content here.

    Create story

    Story telling

    Tulis sebuah konten storytelling pendek yang menyentuh hati dengan struktur [H-A-T-I] (Hook, Alur, Titik Balik, Insight). Ceritanya harus bersifat personal dan relatable untuk audiens umum di media sosial, bisa mengambil tema dari kehidupan sehari-hari, pekerjaan, self-growth, bisnis, atau pengalaman emosional lainnya. Mulailah dengan kalimat pembuka yang langsung mengena (Hook), lanjutkan dengan alur cerita yang mengalir alami (Alur), berikan momen perubahan atau titik balik (Titik Balik), lalu akhiri dengan pelajaran hidup atau refleksi yang kuat (Insight). Gunakan sudut pandang orang pertama, gaya bahasa santai, dan cocok untuk audiens Gen-Z. Maksimal 120 kata, cocok untuk caption Reels atau carousel storytelling.
    Follow up
    • Tambahkan persona: “cowok umur 27, lagi struggle ngejar mimpi sambil kerja kantoran”
    • Minta tone yang spesifik: “tenang dan penuh harapan” atau “pedih tapi inspiratif”'
    • Minta versi storytelling suara kalau mau dijadiin narasi video

    Hook Content

    Tulis pembuka konten (hook) yang powerful menggunakan struktur [C-R-A-C-K]: Claim [klaim berani atau pernyataan tegas), Relate (buat audiens merasa’gue banget’), Agitate (sentuh sedikit rasa frustrasi mereka), Curiosity (bangkitkan rasa penasaran), dan Kickstart [beri transisi menuju isi konten). Gunakan topik yang fleksibel: bisa bisnis, Al, karir, relationship, kesehatan, ataulainnya. Gaya bahasanya harus menarik, singkat, dan cocok buat slide pertama carousel atau opening Reels. Batas maksimal 35 kata, tapi harus bisa bikin orang berhenti scroll.
    Follow up
    • Gunakan kata-kata yang hiper-relevan sama Gen-Z/ niche lo
    • Minta gaya “provokatif tapi relatable” atau “curhat style hook”
    • Selalu tes beberapa versi hook buat tahu mana yang paling engaging.
